intro: Cynoglossum stamineum, commonly known as the blueweed or narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia. It has a short, stout stem that often branches near the base. The flowers bloom in late summer and are visited by various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
